item.title: Gaza war: How close is it to ending?
item.description: President Donald Trump has urged Israel to halt its bombing of Gaza after Hamas agreed to release hostages and accepted some key parts of a US peace plan — a shift that could mean a two-year-old war is finally coming to a close. Israel announced it would work on "immediate implementation" of

item.title: Remittance hits USD 2.68 billion in Sept: BB report
item.description: The inflow of remittances through formal banking channels increased in September compared to the previous two months, with Bangladesh receiving a total of USD 2.68 billion, according to data released by Bangladesh Bank. The central bank’s Monthly Workers’ Remittance Report for Septembe

item.title: US urges allies to shun Havana at UN
item.description: President Donald Trump's administration is mobilizing US diplomats to lobby against a UN resolution calling on Washington to lift its decades-long embargo on Cuba, in part by sharing details of Cuba’s support for Russia’s war in Ukraine, according to an internal State Department cable s

item.title: Energy regulator to review major tariff hike Monday
item.description: A public hearing to assess proposals for a sharp increase in gas tariffs for state-run fertiliser factories will be held on Monday, amid growing concerns over energy costs and supply shortfalls. The Bangladesh Energy Regulatory Commission (BERC) has scheduled the hearing at the BIAM Foundation aud

item.title: Lightning strikes kill 6 in Cumilla, Bogura, Jhenaidah
item.description: Six people were killed and two others injured by lightning strikes in Cumilla, Bogura and Jhenaidah districts on Sunday. Among the deceased, three died in Cumilla, two in Jhenaidah and one in Bogura district. In Cumilla, three people including a student of Bangladesh Agriculture University (BAU)

item.title: 3mn cattle to be vaccinated to curb anthrax
item.description: Three million cattle will be vaccinated across different districts in the Rangpur Division as a part of efforts to prevent the spread of anthrax. Of these, two million doses will be administered in Rangpur and Gaibandha districts, with the vaccines supplied by the Bangladesh Livestock Research Ins

item.title: Bangladesh Shilpakala Academy launches 15-day wood carving workshop
item.description: A 15-day training workshop on wood carving began on Sunday at the National Art Gallery auditorium under the auspices of Bangladesh Shilpakala Academy (BSA) and organized by its Training Division.The inaugural ceremony was held at 12 pm on Sunday, UNB reports. Sheikh Rezauddin Ahmed (poet Rezau

item.title: CUCSU elections: OMR counting, polling centres finalized
item.description: The CUCSU Election Commission has held a meeting with candidates and students to discuss polling centres and voting procedures for the upcoming CUCSU and hall council elections. The meeting, held on Sunday, outlined the possible polling process, including the use of OMR machines for vote counting.

item.title: Humayun elected president, Akik general secretary in BADC Agriculturalists’ Association poll
item.description: In the biannual election of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation (BADC) Agriculturalists’ Association, Md. Humayun Kabir has been elected president, and Dr Md Akikul Islam Akik has been elected general secretary. A total of 60 candidates from
